docs.abstract: Said one expert: “The data on bananas causing suicide is about as conclusive.”
docs.snippet: Said one expert: “The data on bananas causing suicide is about as conclusive.”
docs.lead_paragraph: After two mass shootings over the weekend that killed 31 people and wounded dozens more, powerful Republicans, including the president, blamed an old bogeyman: video games.

headline.main: Video Games Aren’t Why Shootings Happen. Politicians Still Blame Them.
headline.print_headline: Video Games Get Blame, Despite Lack of Evidence

docs.abstract: Profit was down 51 percent from a year earlier as assets acquired from 21st Century Fox underperformed and losses from streaming mounted.
docs.snippet: Profit was down 51 percent from a year earlier as assets acquired from 21st Century Fox underperformed and losses from streaming mounted.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Walt Disney Company reported weak quarterly results Tuesday, the result of escalating streaming-service losses, underperforming 21st Century Fox assets and lower-than-expected theme park attendance.

headline.main: Disney Earnings Disappoint in First Full Quarter After Fox Deal
headline.print_headline: Disney Profits Suffer in First Full Quarter After Fox Deal

docs.abstract: The prohibition was mandated by Congress as part of a broader defense bill signed into law last year.
docs.snippet: The prohibition was mandated by Congress as part of a broader defense bill signed into law last year.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Trump administration on Wednesday took a tactical step in its trade confrontation with China, by releasing a rule that restricts government agencies from doing business with Huawei, the giant Chinese maker of telecommunications equipment and smartphones.

headline.main: U.S. Moves to Ban Huawei From Government Contracts
headline.print_headline: U.S. Moves to Ban Huawei From Government Contracts

docs.abstract: iHeartMedia is planning translated versions of the podcasts it acquired in its $55 million deal for Stuff Media.
docs.snippet: iHeartMedia is planning translated versions of the podcasts it acquired in its $55 million deal for Stuff Media.
docs.lead_paragraph: Three times a week, millions of people who crave detailed explanations of time zones, deepfakes, artificial sweeteners and other trivia listen to the latest episodes of the podcast “Stuff You Should Know.”

headline.main: Radio Giant, Riding Podcast Boom, Takes ‘Stuff You Should Know’ Global
headline.print_headline: For Podcast’s Owner, This Is ‘Stuff’ the World Should Know, Too

docs.abstract: Few students actually paid the published cost. Colleges worried that they would be bypassed if families looked just at the sticker price.
docs.snippet: Few students actually paid the published cost. Colleges worried that they would be bypassed if families looked just at the sticker price.
docs.lead_paragraph: Sunshine Anderson was at Mills College’s annual welcoming ceremony in 2017 when the liberal arts college revealed its big news: It was slashing its tuition by more than a third.

headline.main: More Private Colleges Are Cutting Tuition, but Don’t Expect to Pay Less
headline.print_headline: Tuition Cuts Are Dangled Like Carrots

docs.abstract: The fast-growing Chinese company, blocked by the Trump administration from working with Google, announced plans for its own mobile operating system.
docs.snippet: The fast-growing Chinese company, blocked by the Trump administration from working with Google, announced plans for its own mobile operating system.
docs.lead_paragraph: DONGGUAN, China — Huawei, the Chinese technology giant, on Friday unveiled its own mobile operating system, Harmony, in an effort to ensure that its fast-growing smartphone business can survive the United States government’s clampdown on the firm.

headline.main: Huawei Unveils Harmony, Its Answer to Android, in Survival Bid
headline.print_headline: Huawei Fires Back at U.S. With Answer To Android

docs.abstract: Professional athletes may have big paychecks for a few years, but what happens when their careers end? Some plan for that day better than others.
docs.snippet: Professional athletes may have big paychecks for a few years, but what happens when their careers end? Some plan for that day better than others.
docs.lead_paragraph: Andrew Luck’s announcement that he was retiring from the Indianapolis Colts shocked football fans for two big reasons: He was at the top of his game, despite being repeatedly injured, and he was walking away from some $58 million in the final two years of his contract.

headline.main: Andrew Luck Walked Away From $58 Million, but That’s Not Necessarily Bad
headline.print_headline: A $58 Million Fumble? Not if You Plan Ahead

docs.abstract: The move comes as Beijing fights a costly trade war with the United States while looking for ways to keep its growth going.
docs.snippet: The move comes as Beijing fights a costly trade war with the United States while looking for ways to keep its growth going.
docs.lead_paragraph: BEIJING — China’s central bank moved on Friday to give the country’s slowing economy a jolt, saying it would essentially inject $126 billion into the financial system as Beijing fights an escalating trade war with the United States and contends with a dangerous addiction to debt at home.

headline.main: China Injects $126 Billion Into Its Slowing Economy
headline.print_headline: China Seeks to Rouse Its Slowing Economy With a Cash Infusion

docs.abstract: The proudly contrarian lab has been divided since its director disclosed that he had taken money from the disgraced financier. Its efforts at healing demonstrate lingering cultural questions.
docs.snippet: The proudly contrarian lab has been divided since its director disclosed that he had taken money from the disgraced financier. Its efforts at healing demonstrate lingering cultural questions.
docs.lead_paragraph: Joichi Ito gave himself some advice in 2008: “Reminder to self,” he wrote on Twitter. “Don’t invest with or take money from creeps,” although he used an earthier term.

headline.main: Jeffrey Epstein’s Donations Create a Schism at M.I.T.’s Revered Media Lab
headline.print_headline: Epstein Donations Create Schism At M.I.T.’s Prestigious Media Lab

byline.original: By Tiffany Hsu, Marc Tracy and Erin Griffith

docs.abstract: A small army of real people are building a special edition of the 2020 Acura TLX at American Honda’s Performance Manufacturing Center in Ohio.
docs.snippet: A small army of real people are building a special edition of the 2020 Acura TLX at American Honda’s Performance Manufacturing Center in Ohio.
docs.lead_paragraph: MARYSVILLE, Ohio — For people in the market for an automobile largely built by hand and not robots, a few options come to mind. There are Rolls-Royce and Bentley, certainly. Or consider a $250,000 Ferrari made in the north of Italy, or maybe a $250,000 McLaren from the south of England.

headline.main: This Car Comes in Any Color You Want, So Long as It’s Valencia Red
headline.print_headline: Creating a Car With a Human Touch
